content.en: Pulmonary Embolism Diagnosis: Researchers have been investigating various strategies and diagnostic instruments to improve the diagnosis of pulmonary embolism. These include the use of algorithms and clinical decision rules, as well as new diagnostic instruments such as plasma D-dimer measurement and lower venous compression ultrasonography. By combining these tools, clinicians can make a noninvasive diagnosis in the majority of patients with suspected pulmonary embolism, reducing the need for more invasive procedures like pulmonary angiography.
content.da: Diagnose af lungeemboli: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige strategier og diagnostiske instrumenter for at forbedre diagnosen af lungeemboli. Disse inkluderer brugen af algoritmer og kliniske beslutningsregler samt nye diagnostiske instrumenter som plasma D-dimer måling og ultralydsskanning af de nedre vener. Ved at kombinere disse værktøjer kan klinikere stille en ikke-invasiv diagnose hos de fleste patienter med mistanke om lungeemboli, hvilket reducerer behovet for mere invasive procedurer som pulmonal angiografi.
